reference_summary:
In the Broadband Forum's Technical Report TR-187, "IPv6 for PPP Broadband Access," the term "Requesting Router" (RR) is defined in the context of DHCPv6 Prefix Delegation (PD) as specified in RFC 3633. The RR is a router that acts as a DHCPv6 client, requesting IPv6 prefixes from a Delegating Router (DR), which acts as the DHCPv6 server. In typical broadband access scenarios, the Residential Gateway (RG) functions as the RR, while the Broadband Network Gateway (BNG) or Broadband Remote Access Server (BRAS) serves as the DR. ([broadband-forum.org](https://www.broadband-forum.org/pdfs/tr-187-2-0-0.pdf?utm_source=openai))

The RG, operating as the RR, may obtain an IPv6 address through Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC) or the DHCPv6 Identity Association for Non-temporary Addresses (IA_NA) option. If the RG does not acquire an address via these methods, it can assign itself an address from the delegated prefix to use as a source address for its own IP applications. ([broadband-forum.org](https://www.broadband-forum.org/pdfs/tr-187-2-0-0.pdf?utm_source=openai))

To facilitate proper routing within the home network, the Broadband Forum recommends that service providers delegate an IPv6 address block to the home. For home or Small Office/Home Office (SOHO) environments, a delegated prefix size of at least /60 is suggested, with a recommended length of /56. For larger organizations, the delegated prefix may be extended to a /48. ([broadband-forum.org](https://www.broadband-forum.org/pdfs/tr-187-2-0-0.pdf?utm_source=openai))

By implementing these guidelines, service providers can ensure that every IP-capable host in the home network obtains a globally unique IPv6 address, thereby avoiding the use of Network Address Translation (NAT) between the Home Network and Provider Network. ([broadband-forum.org](https://www.broadband-forum.org/pdfs/tr-187-2-0-0.pdf?utm_source=openai))

reference_summary: In the Broadband Forum's Technical Report TR-187 Issue 2, "IPv6 for PPP Broadband Access," the term "Delegating Router" (DR) is defined as a router that assigns IPv6 prefixes to a Requesting Router (RR) through the DHCPv6 Prefix Delegation mechanism. This process enables the RR to further distribute these prefixes within its local network. The DR is responsible for managing and delegating IPv6 address space to downstream routers, facilitating efficient address allocation and routing in IPv6 networks.
